DOC.brief_summary: This randomize controlled trial comparing use new clinical intervention ( `` Collaborative Assessment Management Suicidality -- CAMS '' ) versus enhance care usual suicidal Soldiers see outpatient mental health clinic Ft. Stewart GA .
DOC.brief_title: Operation Worth Living Project With Suicidal Soldiers Ft. Stewart
DOC.detailed_description: This randomize controlled clinical trial 148 suicidal active-duty US Army Soldiers . Participants randomize on-site provider train Collaborative Assessment Management Suicidality ( CAMS ) vs. provider routine care -- refer Enhanced Care Usual ( E-CAU ) within outpatient military treatment center . The CAMS Rating Scale ( CRS ) use reliably verify fidelity treatment condition adherence CAMS provider model . Participants receive informed consent randomly assign treatment arm ask complete study assessment baseline , 3 month , 6 month , 12 month start treatment . Recruitment complete study assessment complete March 2016 . The study second year cost extension ; outcome data analysis moderator analyse currently underway develop manuscript submission peer-review scientific journal .
DOC.criteria: Active duty Army personnel FSGA Significant suicidal ideation Soldier appropriate FSGA policy Consent baseline follow Consent randomization digitally record Significant psychosis , cognitive physical impairment give consent Judicially order treatment
